data.title: Una Stubbs obituary
data.meta_description: The actress Una Stubbs, best known for her roles in the film Summer Holiday and in the BBC sitcoms Till Death Us Do Part and In Sickness And In Health, has died at the age of 84, her agent has said.Stubbs, who was born in Hertfordshire in 1937, had a career in film, television and theatre spanning d
data.text:
“We’re all going on a summer holiday,” sang Cliff Richard in Summer Holiday (1963), and Una Stubbs came along as Sandy, one of the young women who joined the eternally youthful singer and his three friends on their trip across Europe in a London bus. Stubbs had originally auditioned to be a dancer but was instead selected by Richard for the more prominent role.

The film’s wholesome fun was a hit with audiences and led to them teaming up again in Wonderful Life (1964), a film in similar vein with Stubbs (as Barbara) again to the fore. However, in the mid-1990s she shattered their squeaky clean image by revealing that, despite being married at the time, she had fallen for Britain’s most celibate pop star
